items.title: Trump promise to pardon ex-Honduran president convicted of drug trafficking looms as country votes
items.summary_auto: Two conservative challengers were practically tied for the lead in Honduras's presidential contest, with votes from about 55 per cent of polling places counted early Monday, according to preliminary and partial results.

items.title: Homeowner says she’s out $381K after hiring Ottawa contractor to renovate kitchen
Hong Kong highrise netting did not meet code, officials say, with death toll at 151 people
items.summary_auto: Hong Kong officials said Monday that their investigation into a deadly blaze that killed at least 151 people has revealed some of the netting that covered scaffolding used in renovations was not up to fire-safety codes, as a wave of public sympathy and support was met by government moves to stifle criticism.

items.title: Allegation of 'abominable abuse' of 6-year-old girl by foster parents under investigation: families minister
items.summary_auto: Manitoba’s families minister is conducting an internal investigation into the circumstances that led to a six-year-old girl in foster care suffering injuries that may lead to her being paralyzed for life, search warrant documents show.

items.title: Cape Breton man claims public trustee misused wife's hospital account
items.summary_auto: A senior couple from Richmond County, Cape Breton, say Nova Scotia's public trustee office spent the wife's funds on questionable items while she was in Dartmouth General Hospital due to dementia, but the public trustee says decisions were made in concert with a family member.

items.title: American podiatrist leaving Nova Scotia over bureaucratic frustrations
items.summary_auto: A U.S. podiatrist says he is leaving the province because his patients have to wait years to see a surgeon for procedures on their feet, even though he's trained to do the procedures in his clinic.

items.title: All of Toronto's speed cameras are gone. How did we get to this point?
items.summary_auto: Toronto's speed cameras may be gone, but this time there are no mysterious vandals wielding power tools, no blurry suspect photos and no police investigation.

items.title: Breath samples collected by drone hold clues to health of North Atlantic right whales
items.summary_auto: A newly published study shows the bacteria in the spray from the whales' blowholes can indicate how healthy the individual is.

items.title: Death toll rises, hundreds missing as Indonesia, Sri Lanka and Thailand struggle to reach flood victims
items.summary_auto: Recovery and aid efforts are underway in parts of Southeast Asia and South Asia where the full number of dead and missing are not yet known after heavy rains and flooding left a devastating toll in the past week.

items.title: Pay high duties or lose U.S. shoppers? Some Canadian retailers forced to choose amid holiday sales
items.summary_auto: Months after the U.S. ended duty-free shipping on small packages, Canadian online retailers will have to make a tough gamble: pay pricey fees on low-value shipments, or get a holiday sales boost from American customers?

items.title: Why excavators may be a tool of choice for some cash-seeking thieves
items.summary_auto: This unique form of theft has been happening all over the Greater Toronto Area and beyond. Thieves on the hunt for cash break through the walls of banks using excavators that experts say anyone capable of ordering a key online can drive off the lot.

items.title: Will the U.S. invade Venezuela?
items.summary_auto: Over the weekend, Donald Trump declared on Truth Social that the airspace around Venezuela should be considered closed. Venezuela’s foreign ministry responded by calling the comments "another extravagant, illegal and unjustified aggression against the Venezuelan people". Late last week, Trump also said that land action against alleged drug trafficking networks in the country could start very soon.

items.title: WestJet and Air Transat passengers fight back after airlines falsely claim they can’t film disputes
items.summary_auto: Jason Huang says a WestJet employee grabbed his phone and threatened to deny him boarding when he began recording his conversation during airport check-in. Legal expert say passengers are within their rights to record these interactions, and video and audio recordings may help in battles for compensation.

items.title: #TheMoment the Vancouver Whitecaps advanced to their first MLS Cup final
items.summary_auto: Vancouver Southsiders president Peter Czimmermann tells The National about the moment the group of Whitecaps supporters travelled to San Diego and watched the team advance to the MLS Cup final for the first time in the club’s history.

items.title: Cleanup continues after train derailment and propane leak east of Cranbrook, B.C.
items.summary_auto: Cleanup is still underway east of Cranbrook, B.C., after a train derailment caused a propane leak and forced the evacuation of some rural properties along the Kootenay River this weekend.

items.title: Why does Trump keep berating female reporters?
items.summary_auto: U.S. President Donald Trump's recent remarks towards female journalists, including calling one 'piggy,' is renewing discussion about how much journalists are expected to tolerate as they do their jobs. Industry experts suggest these incidents are 'an unmistakable pattern of hostility — often directed at women — that undermines the essential role of a free and independent press.'

items.title: Calgary food hall ordered to close by Alberta health authority due to 'pest activity'
items.summary_auto: A Calgary food hall says it has been closed for the time being due to "pest activity" identified by Alberta Health Services.

items.title: Calgary food hall ordered to close by AHS due to 'pest activity'
items.summary_auto: A Calgary food hall says it has been closed for the time being due to "pest activity" identified by Alberta Health Services.

items.title: Olympic runner Moh Ahmed wins his 1st Canadian cross-country title
items.summary_auto: In his long-awaited return to the Canadian cross-country championships, Olympic track medallist Moh Ahmed took control late in the open men’s 10-kilometre race and won in 29 minutes 30.4 seconds at Fanshawe Golf Course on Saturday in London, Ont.

items.title: Children among 4 dead in birthday party mass shooting, California police say
items.summary_auto: Authorities in California asked the public for tips on Sunday in finding the person responsible for a shooting a day earlier that left four people dead, three of them children, at a family gathering at a banquet hall in Stockton and wounded many more.

items.title: Ottawa Charge head coach Carla MacLeod diagnosed with breast cancer
items.summary_auto: Carla MacLeod says that while she'll begin treatment this week and will miss the Charge's upcoming game on Tuesday, she plans to return to the PWHL club later this season.
